Title: Planet Forward Experiential Learning Trips
Eligibility: Undergraduate and graduate students at GWU
Description: Sustainability-focused storytelling trips where students travel domestically or internationally to explore environmental and climate issues and share their stories.

Title: Seeds of the Future Fellowship
Organization: GW Food Safety and Security Policy Institute
Eligibility: Undergraduate and graduate students interested in food systems and sustainability
Description: Interdisciplinary fellowship supporting projects that advance sustainable food systems, food safety, and climate-resilient agriculture.

Title: Knapp Fellowship for Entrepreneurial Service-Learning
Description: Provides up to $5,000 for social innovation projects that combine academic learning with community service.

Title: New Venture Competition (NVC)
Description: Annual pitch competition where students present business, tech, or social ventures for a chance to win funding, mentorship, and exposure.

Title: Pitch George Competition
Description: Elevator-style business pitch competition for GW students to practice pitching and receive feedback from judges; cash prizes awarded to top ideas.
